data.title: Cities populations
data.solution:
n = int(input())
entries = [input() for _ in range(n)]
search = input()

entries = dict((tuple(e.split(" ")) for e in entries))
print(sum(int(entries[k]) for k in entries.keys() if search in k))
data.statement: Return the <<total>> sum of population of the <<searched>> cities

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 20
0 < [[POPULATION]]
Cities names are all distinct and without space in it.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read city:word(50) population:int
read search:string(256)

write total
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> the number [[N]] of cities
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> city's name and its population: "[[NAME]] [[POPULATION]]"
<<Last lines:>> a string [[SEARCH]] that is a substring of cities names
data.outputDescription:
The total sum of population of all searched cities.
Return 0 if there is no match.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Return the total sum of population of the searched cities
Input
Line 1: the number N of cities
Next N lines: city's name and its population: "NAME POPULATION"
Last lines: a string SEARCH that is a substring of cities names
Output
The total sum of population of all searched cities.
Return 0 if there is no match.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 20
0 < POPULATION
Cities names are all distinct and without space in it.
Example
Input
3
Tokyo 37
Paris 10
London 9
Lon
Output
9
